raw: * A *spinner* is a control that allows you to adjust a numerical value,
* typically within an allowed range. An obvious example would be to specify the
* month of a year as a number in the range 1 - 12.
* To do so, a spinner encompasses a field to display the current value (a
* textfield) and controls such as up and down buttons to change that value. The
* current value can also be changed by editing the display field directly, or
* using mouse wheel and cursor keys.
* An optional {@link #numberFormat} property allows you to control the format of
* how a value can be entered and will be displayed.
* A brief, but non-trivial example:
* <pre class='javascript'>
* var s = new qx.ui.form.Spinner();
* s.set({
*   maximum: 3000,
*   minimum: -3000
* var nf = new qx.util.format.NumberFormat();
* nf.setMaximumFractionDigits(2);
* s.setNumberFormat(nf);
*
* A spinner instance without any further properties specified in the
* constructor or a subsequent *set* command will appear with default
* values and behaviour.
* @childControl textfield {qx.ui.form.TextField} holds the current value of the spinner
* @childControl upbutton {qx.ui.form.Button} button to increase the value
* @childControl downbutton {qx.ui.form.Button} button to decrease the value

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
A spinner is a control that allows you to adjust a numerical value, typically within an allowed range. An obvious example would be to specify the month of a year as a number in the range 1 - 12. To do so, a spinner encompasses a field to display the current value (a textfield) and controls such as up and down buttons to change that value. The current value can also be changed by editing the display field directly, or using mouse wheel and cursor keys. An optional {@link #numberFormat} property allows you to control the format of how a value can be entered and will be displayed. A brief, but non-trivial example: 

 var s = new qx.ui.form.Spinner();
 s.set({
   maximum: 3000,
   minimum: -3000
 });
 var nf = new qx.util.format.NumberFormat();
 nf.setMaximumFractionDigits(2);
 s.setNumberFormat(nf);

A spinner instance without any further properties specified in the constructor or a subsequent set command will appear with default values and behaviour.

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: textfield {qx.ui.form.TextField} holds the current value of the spinner

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: upbutton {qx.ui.form.Button} button to increase the value

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: downbutton {qx.ui.form.Button} button to decrease the value

raw: * The 'contentPadding' property is a shorthand property for setting 'contentPaddingTop',
* 'contentPaddingRight', 'contentPaddingBottom' and 'contentPaddingLeft'
* at the same time.
* If four values are specified they apply to top, right, bottom and left respectively.
* If there is only one value, it applies to all sides, if there are two or three,
* the missing values are taken from the opposite side.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The 'contentPadding' property is a shorthand property for setting 'contentPaddingTop', 'contentPaddingRight', 'contentPaddingBottom' and 'contentPaddingLeft' at the same time. If four values are specified they apply to top, right, bottom and left respectively. If there is only one value, it applies to all sides, if there are two or three, the missing values are taken from the opposite side.

* value and the given min property value.
* @param value {Number} The new value of the min property
* @param old {Number} The old value of the min property

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Apply routine for the minimum property. It sets the value of the spinner to the maximum of the current spinner value and the given min property value.

raw: overridden
* Check whether the value being applied is allowed.
* If you override this to change the allowed type, you will also
* want to override {@link #_applyValue}, {@link #_applyMinimum},
* {@link #_applyMaximum}, {@link #_countUp}, {@link #_countDown}, and
* {@link #_onTextChange} methods as those cater specifically to numeric
* values.
* @param value {var}
*   The value being set
* @return {Boolean}
* true if the value is allowed;
*   <i>false> otherwise.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Check whether the value being applied is allowed. If you override this to change the allowed type, you will also want to override {@link #applyValue}, {@link #applyMinimum}, {@link #applyMaximum}, {@link #countUp}, {@link #countDown}, and {@link #onTextChange} methods as those cater specifically to numeric values.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
value {var}
   The value being set
@param.description: The value being set

@return.name: @return
@return.description: true if the value is allowed; false> otherwise.

raw: * Callback for "keyDown" event.
* Controls the interval mode ("single" or "page")
* and the interval increase by detecting "Up"/"Down"
* and "PageUp"/"PageDown" keys.
* The corresponding button will be pressed.
* @param e {qx.event.type.KeySequence} keyDown event

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Callback for "keyDown" event.
Controls the interval mode ("single" or "page") and the interval increase by detecting "Up"/"Down" and "PageUp"/"PageDown" keys.
The corresponding button will be pressed.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: e {qx.event.type.KeySequence} keyDown event
@param.description: keyDown event

raw: * Callback for "keyUp" event.
* Detecting "Up"/"Down" and "PageUp"/"PageDown" keys.
* Releases the button and disabled the page mode, if necessary.
* @param e {qx.event.type.KeySequence} keyUp event

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Callback for "keyUp" event.
Detecting "Up"/"Down" and "PageUp"/"PageDown" keys.
Releases the button and disabled the page mode, if necessary.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: e {qx.event.type.KeySequence} keyUp event
@param.description: keyUp event
